Line 48: Line 48:
=='''Course'''==
=='''Course'''==
â
[[File:BellinRunStart.jpg|thumb]]
+
[[File:BellinRunStart.jpg|thumb|Bellin Run Start of the 2010 Race]]
â
:The Bellin Run is a 10k or 6.2 mile road race that weaves through downtown Green Bay. The race starts out in front of Bellin Hospital on Webster Avenue under the skywalk in front hundreds of spectators. The race brings participants South on Webster Avenue, and continues through the streets of downtown Green Bay and Allouez finishing back on Webster and under the skywalk for the finish. The course is relatively flat, with the exception of an extended downhill stretch on Greene Ave. The roads are closed for that morning to ensure safety, and a collaboration of safety departments from surrounding towns help to ensure the safety of participants and spectators. Times are given at each mile point and water stations are located at 1.8, 3.4, 4.7 and 5.7 mile distances. Medical personnel are available on the course for any person in need of assistance.<ref>http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/6055594-bellin-run-2010</ref>
+
The Bellin Run is a 10k or 6.2 mile road race that weaves through downtown Green Bay. The race starts out in front of Bellin Hospital on Webster Avenue under the skywalk in front hundreds of spectators. The race brings participants South on Webster Avenue, and continues through the streets of downtown Green Bay and Allouez finishing back on Webster and under the skywalk for the finish. The course is relatively flat, with the exception of an extended downhill stretch on Greene Ave. The roads are closed for that morning to ensure safety, and a collaboration of safety departments from surrounding towns help to ensure the safety of participants and spectators. Times are given at each mile point and water stations are located at 1.8, 3.4, 4.7 and 5.7 mile distances. Medical personnel are available on the course for any person in need of assistance.<ref>http://www.allvoices.com/contributed-news/6055594-bellin-run-2010</ref>
==='''Back to the Road Crew'''===
==='''Back to the Road Crew'''===
â
:Individuals who have faced recovery and rehabilitation from surgery or a major illness and want to get âBack to the Roadâ participate in a shortened course through the Back to the Road Crew program. The program helps get orthopedic, cardiac rehab and general rehab patients active again after medical treatment. It is an invitation-only event. These participants will be walking or running a shortened 1 mile route of the Bellin Run, however, some complete the entire 10K route.<ref>http://www.bellinrun.com/programs/back-to-the-road-crew.html</ref>
+
Individuals who have faced recovery and rehabilitation from surgery or a major illness and want to get âBack to the Roadâ participate in a shortened course through the Back to the Road Crew program. The program helps get orthopedic, cardiac rehab and general rehab patients active again after medical treatment. It is an invitation-only event. These participants will be walking or running a shortened 1 mile route of the Bellin Run, however, some complete the entire 10K route.<ref>http://www.bellinrun.com/programs/back-to-the-road-crew.html</ref>
==='''Course Entertainment'''===
==='''Course Entertainment'''===
â
:The Bellin Run plays host to several different hotspots of entertainment throughout the course. This gesture is meant to help entertain the runners as they pass by, and also to entertain the families that live on or around the course. There is plenty to hear along the 10k 6.2 mile course.<ref>http://www.greenbaypressgazette.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=2010100612043</ref>
+
The Bellin Run plays host to several different hotspots of entertainment throughout the course. This gesture is meant to help entertain the runners as they pass by, and also to entertain the families that live on or around the course. There is plenty to hear along the 10k 6.2 mile course.<ref>http://www.greenbaypressgazette.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=2010100612043</ref>
